intro: Phlomoides multifurcata, commonly known as the branched bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, tubular blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often covered in a fine, silky hair. Phlomoides multifurcata is typically found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments.
